newsitem.title: ITALY: Max rate 7.95 pct at Italy 1.5 trln lire BOT sale.
newsitem.headline: Max rate 7.95 pct at Italy 1.5 trln lire BOT sale.

text.p: The maximum rate at today's 1.5 trillion lire sale of February 28, 1997 Treasury bills (BOTs) by the Bank of Italy was 7.95 percent.
The Bank said it received 18 bids of which three were met in full and four in part.
At the last sale of 1.0 trillion lire worth of BOTs on July 5, the maximum rate was 8.93 percent and average 8.87 percent.
At its last buyback operation on October 14, the central bank bought 2.5 trillion lire worth of bills at a minimum rate of 7.51 percent and average rate of 7.64 percent.
